page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: From the bridge,built in 1674,some of the most prominent buildings in and around Corbridge can be seen.The Tower of the medieval Church,with its Anglo_Saxon base and Roman stonework still dominates the centre.The Roman Watling Street was the major North to South route and its river crossing point gave Corstopitum its strategic importance.Many village streets follow medieval lines and the medieval past still touches the present throng of buildings such as the Vicar's Pele and Low Hall.The King's Oven and overgrown St.Andrews Well both recall the communal life of the medieval village.To the west of the village Beaufront Castle is an imposing country house built in the nineteenth century.
